job_description: Artificial Intelligence Leader, Life Sciences - SFL Scientific - job post Deloitte 11,490 reviews 655 West Broadway Suite 700, San Diego, CA 92101 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Artificial Intelligence Leader, Life Sciences - SFL Scientific SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, is a U.S. based, data science consulting firm specializing in building mission-specific, artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. The practice brings together several key capabilities to develop and transform our clients' organizations through AI & Data Strategy. We are looking for an Artificial Intelligence Leader, Life Sciences to support the vision, strategy, and execution of our Artificial Intelligence go-to-market initiatives within the Life Sciences, Medical Device, & Pharmaceutical sectors. Join us to expand your technical career through the lens of professional services and consulting and help create novel solutions to advance your data science & AI career. Work you'll do As the Artificial Intelligence Leader, Life Sciences , you will be responsible for helping to identify, advocate, and execute Deloitte's interests across international and emerging life sciences organizations, with a specific focus on novel approaches in natural language processing, computer vision for medical imaging & autonomous systems, embedded & edge-AI, and other state-of-the-art capabilities. The individual is responsible for building the relationship between Deloitte and the client, helping architect novel AI solutions and capabilities to generate client impact, as well as planning and penetrating target technology areas and supporting AI integration and deployment. The candidate will work with senior leaders within SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business. The practice has a proven track record serving large, market-leading organizations in the private and public sectors, successfully delivering high-quality, novel and complex projects, offering deep domain, R&D, and scientific capabilities. The Team Our practice is focused on helping Life Sciences organizations make strategic choices to unlock new growth, elevate the customer experience, drive innovation, and enable competitive advantage. Deloitte's services and solutions provide actionable insights that enable our Life Sciences clients to formulate near- and long-term strategies to address their most pressing issues and provide clear path for implementation Made up of experienced AI strategists, data scientists, and AI engineers, they serve as trusted advisors to executives, helping them understand and evaluate new and essential areas for AI investment and identify unique opportunities to transform their businesses. Basic Qualifications: Master's or Ph.D. preferred in STEM field, high proficiency in Artificial Intelligence, machine learning, and life sciences for professional services Expert in traditional ML and deep learning techniques (CNNs, RNNs, LSTMs, GANs), model tuning, and validation of data science and statistical algorithms 6+ years of experience and excellent knowledge of the Life Sciences, Medical Device, or Biotech sectors 5+ years of previous experience in managing technical or solutions teams and delivering complex AI/ML and analytics workloads 3+ years of experience in business and relationship development, proposal management and management of enterprise accounts or technical solutions in complex organizations Demonstrated ability to advise on a variety of high impact problems/projects through in-depth evaluation of complex business processes, system processes, and technical requirements Limited immigration sponsorship may be available Live within commuting distance to one of Deloitte's consulting offices Ability to travel 10% on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $200,000 to $275,000. You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. #MonitorDeloitte #DeloitteJobs #StrategyConsulting #DeloitteStrategy #Strategy23 #SFL23 #SFLAIExec23

Display System Architect- Platform Architecture - job post Apple 11,770 reviews San Diego, CA Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Summary Posted: Dec 19, 2022 Weekly Hours: 40 Role Number: 200452002 Do you love working on state-of-the-art technologies? Are you a forward-thinking and love solving technological and architectural challenge? We at Apple, our Platform Architecture team features collaboration and hands-on environment that cultivates engineering excellence, creativity, and innovation! Join this team, and you’ll collaborate with engineers across Apple to develop algorithms and architectures that help build the flawless technology experiences we’re known for worldwide! In this highly visible role, you will lead the architecture of SoC display subsystem, including memory fabric interface, data pipe flow controls, memory compression, display interfaces, and etc. Key Qualifications BS and 20+ years of relevant industry experience in signal processing/image processing. MS or Ph.D. preferred. The ideal candidate will have experience in chip architecture, display subsystem architecture, design experience with a complete understanding of the technology SoC display subsystem architecture and micro-architecture knowledge Thorough understanding of SoC display sub-system architecture, interface, performance and energy tradeoffs Broad understanding of display technology Demonstrated expertise in memory sub-system, memory interface, and DMA Demonstrated architectural modeling ability Strong communication skills with cross-functional teams Description The ideal candidate will be responsible for all aspects of SoC display subsystem architecture: - Work closely with SoC and fabric architects, software, and system engineers to architect SoC display subsystem - Architect display subsystems, including display pipe control, memory, and interfaces - Provide detailed architectural guidance at all levels of design throughout the design process from concept through production - Make recommendation on key design tradeoffs across architecture and performance - Author and maintain the display subsystem architecture specifications Education & Experience BS and 20+ years of relevant industry experience in signal processing/image processing. MS or Ph.D. preferred. Additional Requirements Pay & Benefits At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $166,500 and $250,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Communications Engineer - job post The MITRE Corporation 281 reviews San Diego, CA 92121 • Hybrid remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us. MITRE’s Naval Division is focused on delivering innovative concepts, technologies and methodologies that enable current and future U.S. Naval superiority. Our Naval work program has a broad and dynamic set of projects that focus on research engineering, systems engineering, agile acquisition, cyber security, experimentation, and prototyping. We are seeking innovative and energetic engineers, technologists and domain experts to join our talented team in delivering valuable products and capabilities that have high impact on the Navy and our National Security. Come to MITRE San Diego and provide the U.S. Navy with Command, Control, Communications, Computers, & Intelligence (C4I) and Space capabilities to operate in all domains. At MITRE San Diego, we strive to be the Government's architect for the Information Age, recognized as a leader for C4I Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) systems engineering and maritime security, a gateway for San Diego sponsors to the whole of MITRE, and a corporate resource to leverage the capabilities, organizations, and talent of the western U.S. MITRE’s diverse work program provides opportunities to apply your expertise and creative thinking in challenging domains such as command and control, intelligence systems, and communications systems. Employees may also participate in MITRE’s internal research and development program, which provides funding for innovative applied research that addresses our sponsors’ hardest problems. The successful candidate for this position is an experienced communications engineer who combines a solid theoretical and technical background with the ability to formulate problems, develop and evaluate solutions, and communicate results. This position requires creative problem solving through novel applications of communications engineering principles in collaboration with diverse and geographically dispersed teams. The ideal candidate will have a working knowledge of communication system design and be able to apply that knowledge to perform analysis and solve problems. Additionally, the ideal candidate will be able to engage with stakeholders to analyze operational requirements, address communications network challenges, apply sound technological solutions, and advance the state of communications and networking. Job Responsibilities: Provide technical leadership in communications engineering to shape requirements, technology assessments, and development and implementation strategies for the modernization and fielding of critical Naval capabilities Serve as a key contributor to or leader of dynamic, multi-disciplined teams that develop technical solutions through innovation Collaborate with sponsors in the application of analytical techniques to address their hardest communications challenges Clearly and concisely communicate highly technical analyses and recommendations to sponsors and partners in written and verbal products Implement communications engineering principles to develop data-driven insights and mature them into actionable recommendations that achieve mission outcomes for the Navy Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree with 5 years of relevant experience in Electrical Engineering, Communications Engineering, or a related field; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with relevant experience who can immediately contribute at this job step Ability obtain and maintain a Secret level security clearance Possess an understanding of link budgets, communications protocols, digital signal processing, detection and estimation theory, and information theory Experience with topics of RF communications theory, including modulation types, error correction coding, channel effects, antenna performance modeling, software defined radios, and military and commercial satellite systems Strong systems engineering skills and familiarity with independent Verification & Validation (V&V) testing Experience with C++, Python, MATLAB, or other modeling and analysis tools Possess the familiarity with Communications Engineering processes required to provide unbiased advice, formulate courses of action, analyze programs, and make recommendations Ability to work independently to learn new technologies, techniques, processes, software languages, platforms, and systems Demonstrated proficiency and strength in verbal, written, presentation, and communication skills Preferred Qualifications : Bachelor’s Degree and 8 years of related experience in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Communications Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field; or 6 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years’ experience Ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI level security clearance Familiarity with Naval C4I & Space systems from technical and/or operational perspectives Familiarity with a range of systems engineering lifecycle activities including, but not limited to, requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, and sustainment Familiarity with machine learning or artificial intelligence algorithms and applications Expert knowledge of and/or experience with: MIDS JTRS Radio and the TTNT Waveform Link 16, SATCOM systems, and other military data links Tactical communications under Denied, Degraded, Intermittent, and Low-bandwidth conditions Techniques and implementation approaches for navigation and time synchronization Radio design trade-offs and system performance evaluation (throughput, delay, reliability) Naval TACAIR Platforms, Net Enabled Weapons, Surface and UxV platforms Naval CONEMPs and their development processes Unmanned Platforms This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s): None This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s): Secret Salary compensation range and midpoint: $114,500 - $143,000 - $171,500 Annual Work Location Type: Hybrid Subject to all federal and state laws, rules and regulations, MITRE requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. MITRE will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who are legally entitled to an exemption under applicable laws so long as it does not create an undue hardship for MITRE and/or does not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of the employee or others in the workplace. MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wireless Systems Engineer - job post Apple 11,770 reviews San Diego, CA Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Summary Posted: Mar 17, 2023 Weekly Hours: 40 Role Number: 200462807 Do you have a passion for wireless technologies? Do you want to impact the wireless experience for billions of users? Come and join us! You will become part of a hands-on development team that furthers engineering finesse, creativity, and innovation with a prime focus on wireless accuracy and performance. Dynamic, encouraging people and innovative technologies are the norm here. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! Join Apple’s System RF organization and drive innovation that matters! We’re looking for engineers who will re-imagine the most effective ways to coordinate and manage antenna test systems through collaboration with multi-functional teams and antenna design activities with designers. You may have opportunities to visit many System RF design labs, work with design teams in each location to set up standard methodologies and provide training. Our engineers help architect, research, and design, Apple’s world-class wireless products. All members of the numerous teams within the organization bring their own unique expertise to collectively bring wireless technologies to our products, following Apple’s culture of excellence in engineering principles and practices. Key Qualifications Proficiency in measuring, debugging, and calibrating RF test equipments (eg: anechoic chamber, network analyzer, signal generator, signal analyzer, wireless network emulator) Ability to read and write clean, clear, efficient and understandable code in one or more relevant programming languages (C, C++, Python) Critical problem solving and debugging skills Ability to break down complex problems and evaluate tradeoffs between proposed solutions Energy and aim to thrive in a start-up like environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Description In this role you will create, develop, enforce, and maintain solid documentation on regular auditing and calibrating of wireless RF anechoic chambers. The ideal candidate will be involved in Authoring scalable software in C/C++/Python or any other programming language for controlling, automating, and uploading/analyzing of calibration data. You will collect, analyze and publish data internally & multi-functionally within Apple and deliver clear recommendations to multi-functional teams on resolving wireless system issues (including but not limited to calibration and maintenance of RF test equipments such as VNA, spectrum analyzer, amplifies, etc.) You will partner with operations and factory engineering teams worldwide to follow a standard process of maintaining RF test equipments. Ideal candidates will possess an energetic personality with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, attention to detail and aesthetic sensibility. This position requires strengths in creating thorough design of experiments, manipulating/analyzing datasets, and visualizing results concisely and effectively. Up to 25% of travel may be required Education & Experience Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering or Telecommunication Engineering is needed. Master's degree or PhD/Doctorate highly valued. Additional Requirements We see the more you have of the following as a BONUS: 5+ years of industry experience or equivalent Recent experience in OTA characterization Recent experience in managing junior engineers, technicians or contractors. Pay & Benefits At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,000 and $217,500, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Staff Software Engineer - job post Teradata 492 reviews San Diego, CA Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time OUR TEAM This position is for Staff Engineer for OS Engineering team. OSE Team is comprised of engineers working on core kernel, debugging, testing automation and validation, working towards the same goal: to provide comprehensive, reliable, and scalable solutions for the Teradata SQL Engine (i.e. Teradata Database) for our supported public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). We are looking for a candidate to join our fast paced and cutting-edge development organization that is on the forefront of our “Teradata Everywhere” strategy. Teradata Labs, the technology research and development (R&D) organization within Teradata Corporation, has been turning innovative decision support technology into business results for over 30 years. Our R&D team of analytic architects, database developers and engineers work to understand and advance emerging technologies to invent the next wave of cutting-edge analytic data solutions. Responsibilities: This position is for Staff Engineer for OS Engineering team within the Vantage Core, Platform Software organization. The position involves being part of the OS software engineering teams responsible for the development, integration, functional and performance testing of OS Level features for our public cloud and on-premise solutions. The engineer will be responsible for: ensuring the timely delivery of committed features liaising with other engineering teams for key features. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, empathetic, and creative engineer who is ready to participate in an agile team environment and contribute to the success of Teradata. Given our team’s focus on solutions in the cloud, the ideal candidate should also have experience working on projects on Linux Kernel, AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud. Experience with Teradata Vantage is also preferred. Job Functions: Implements SW Features on Teradata cloud and on-prem offering at OS level. Qualifications: Experience working in fast paced agile scrum development environment. Deep understanding of Linux Kernel concepts. Experience with public and/or private cloud environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, VMWare ESXi, etc. Proficiency with C, bash and Python. Experience with complex network topology setup. Ability to provide assistance to our customer facing teams in customer support cases related to Linux OS escalated to engineering. Ability to provide similar support to internal development teams as well on OS issues/questions. Knowledge of and experience with DevOps automation tools and libraries a plus. Experience working with ARM processors a plus. Experience with Teradata Vantage a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Minimum Education and Residency Requirements: Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline with 8+ years of work experience. Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related discipline with 6+ years of work experience. PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related discipline with 3+ years of work experience requirement.
